algstat 0.1.0.904
  • Reference

Compute Subsets

subsets.Rd

Compute the subsets of a given set.

subsets(set, sizes = 1:length(set), include_null = FALSE)

Arguments

set

the original set
sizes

desired size(s) of subsets
include_null

should the empty vector be included?

Value

a list of subsets as vectors

Details

Note that this algorithm is run in R: it is therefore not intended to be the most efficient algorithm for computins subsets.

See also

utils::combn()

Examples



subsets(1:3)
#> [[1]]
#> [1] 1
#> 
#> [[2]]
#> [1] 2
#> 
#> [[3]]
#> [1] 3
#> 
#> [[4]]
#> [1] 1 2
#> 
#> [[5]]
#> [1] 1 3
#> 
#> [[6]]
#> [1] 2 3
#> 
#> [[7]]
#> [1] 1 2 3
#> 
subsets(1:3, size = 2)
#> [[1]]
#> [1] 1 2
#> 
#> [[2]]
#> [1] 1 3
#> 
#> [[3]]
#> [1] 2 3
#> 
subsets(1:3, include_null = TRUE)
#> [[1]]
#> integer(0)
#> 
#> [[2]]
#> [1] 1
#> 
#> [[3]]
#> [1] 2
#> 
#> [[4]]
#> [1] 3
#> 
#> [[5]]
#> [1] 1 2
#> 
#> [[6]]
#> [1] 1 3
#> 
#> [[7]]
#> [1] 2 3
#> 
#> [[8]]
#> [1] 1 2 3
#> 

subsets(c('a','b','c','d'))
#> [[1]]
#> [1] "a"
#> 
#> [[2]]
#> [1] "b"
#> 
#> [[3]]
#> [1] "c"
#> 
#> [[4]]
#> [1] "d"
#> 
#> [[5]]
#> [1] "a" "b"
#> 
#> [[6]]
#> [1] "a" "c"
#> 
#> [[7]]
#> [1] "a" "d"
#> 
#> [[8]]
#> [1] "b" "c"
#> 
#> [[9]]
#> [1] "b" "d"
#> 
#> [[10]]
#> [1] "c" "d"
#> 
#> [[11]]
#> [1] "a" "b" "c"
#> 
#> [[12]]
#> [1] "a" "b" "d"
#> 
#> [[13]]
#> [1] "a" "c" "d"
#> 
#> [[14]]
#> [1] "b" "c" "d"
#> 
#> [[15]]
#> [1] "a" "b" "c" "d"
#> 
subsets(c('a','b','c','d'), include_null = TRUE)
#> [[1]]
#> character(0)
#> 
#> [[2]]
#> [1] "a"
#> 
#> [[3]]
#> [1] "b"
#> 
#> [[4]]
#> [1] "c"
#> 
#> [[5]]
#> [1] "d"
#> 
#> [[6]]
#> [1] "a" "b"
#> 
#> [[7]]
#> [1] "a" "c"
#> 
#> [[8]]
#> [1] "a" "d"
#> 
#> [[9]]
#> [1] "b" "c"
#> 
#> [[10]]
#> [1] "b" "d"
#> 
#> [[11]]
#> [1] "c" "d"
#> 
#> [[12]]
#> [1] "a" "b" "c"
#> 
#> [[13]]
#> [1] "a" "b" "d"
#> 
#> [[14]]
#> [1] "a" "c" "d"
#> 
#> [[15]]
#> [1] "b" "c" "d"
#> 
#> [[16]]
#> [1] "a" "b" "c" "d"
#>
